tasks.title: Ask questions that you want answers to
tasks.description: Choose 3 questions that genuinely interest you and journal potential answers.

tasks.title: Address a problem
tasks.description: Identify a problem you want to explore through writing. Write a brief paragraph describing why this problem matters.

tasks.title: Articulate speech practice
tasks.description: Record yourself speaking for 3 minutes about something you're passionate about. Listen and note areas for improvement.

tasks.title: Orient yourself properly
tasks.description: Practice active listening during a conversation today. Reflect on how it improved the exchange.

tasks.title: Read widely
tasks.description: Find and read an article related to your chosen problem. Take notes on key insights.

tasks.title: Practice experimentation
tasks.description: Record yourself explaining the same concept in three different ways. Note which feels most effective.

tasks.title: Consider your intent
tasks.description: Before a discussion, pause to consider your intent. Journal how this affected interactions.

tasks.title: Formalized thinking
tasks.description: Take a complex thought and write it in clear, structured sentences. Revise for precision.

tasks.title: Capture attention
tasks.description: Practice 3 opening lines for a topic. Record and analyze which grabs attention best.

tasks.title: Engage with problems
tasks.description: Choose an interesting problem. Map out its aspects using a mind map.

tasks.title: Integrate personality
tasks.description: Rewrite a paragraph about your problem with your unique voice. Compare with previous work.

tasks.title: Free speech practice
tasks.description: Speak extemporaneously for 3 minutes on a topic without notes. Focus on authenticity.

tasks.title: Internalized conversation
tasks.description: Argue both sides of an issue in your mind. Journal insights gained.

tasks.title: Deliberate practice
tasks.description: Rewrite a paragraph three ways. Analyze which communicates most effectively.

tasks.title: Diagnose language inputs
tasks.description: Listen to 3 speakers (podcast, video, etc.). Rate their articulacy on a 1-10 scale.

tasks.title: Intellectual humility
tasks.description: Identify three topics where you lack knowledge. Practice acknowledging these confidently.

tasks.title: Multiple drafts
tasks.description: Rewrite an important sentence ten ways. Select the best version.

tasks.title: 3x5 language diet
tasks.description: Spend time with 3 high-quality language sources (reading, poetry, listening).

tasks.title: Value free speech
tasks.description: Reflect on how free speech aids learning. Write a short note on your thoughts.

tasks.title: Condense chapters
tasks.description: Summarize a piece you’ve written into a 10-sentence outline.

tasks.title: Reduce dead phrases
tasks.description: Record a 3-minute talk, avoiding fillers like 'um' or 'you know.' Review your progress.

tasks.title: Systems thinking
tasks.description: Map interconnections of a problem using a diagram.

tasks.title: Argumentative paragraph
tasks.description: Write a paragraph with evidence supporting an argument.

tasks.title: Audience questions
tasks.description: Prepare a speech anticipating 3 audience questions.

tasks.title: Research cognitive biases
tasks.description: Read about a cognitive bias and note how to mitigate it.

tasks.title: Add evidence
tasks.description: Add evidence to your argumentative paragraph from Day 8.

tasks.title: Personal story
tasks.description: Craft a 3-minute personal story for a speech.

tasks.title: Pros and cons
tasks.description: List pros and cons for a decision you’re facing.

tasks.title: Passionate topic
tasks.description: Write a piece on a topic you’re passionate about.

tasks.title: Relaxed speech
tasks.description: Practice a speech after a relaxation exercise.

tasks.title: Unconventional solutions
tasks.description: Brainstorm 5 unconventional solutions to a problem.

tasks.title: Revise for conciseness
tasks.description: Revise a previous piece to make it more concise.

tasks.title: Deliberate pauses
tasks.description: Prepare a speech with intentional pauses for effect.

tasks.title: Formulate questions
tasks.description: Write 5 questions on a topic and attempt answers.

tasks.title: Transitional words
tasks.description: Write a piece using transitional words for flow.

tasks.title: Different audiences
tasks.description: Prepare a speech for 3 different audience types.

tasks.title: Mindfulness
tasks.description: Practice mindfulness for 10 minutes, then reflect on focus.

tasks.title: Unfamiliar genre
tasks.description: Write a short piece in a genre you’ve never tried.

tasks.title: Visual aid
tasks.description: Create a simple visual aid for a 3-minute speech.

tasks.title: Logical fallacies
tasks.description: Read about a logical fallacy and identify it in an argument.

tasks.title: Share for feedback
tasks.description: Share a piece with someone and note their feedback.

tasks.title: Impromptu speech
tasks.description: Deliver a 3-minute impromptu speech on a random topic.

tasks.title: Reflect on decisions
tasks.description: Analyze the thought process behind a recent decision.

tasks.title: Structured essay
tasks.description: Write an essay with intro, body, and conclusion.

tasks.title: Rhetorical devices
tasks.description: Prepare a speech using 2 rhetorical devices.

tasks.title: Moral dilemma
tasks.description: Analyze a moral dilemma and journal your reasoning.

tasks.title: Persuasive piece
tasks.description: Write a persuasive piece using ethos, pathos, logos.

tasks.title: Difficult questions
tasks.description: Prepare answers for 3 tough questions on your topic.

tasks.title: Brainstorm creatively
tasks.description: Brainstorm 10 creative solutions to a problem.

tasks.title: Revise for style
tasks.description: Revise a piece to enhance its stylistic elements.

tasks.title: Call to action
tasks.description: Prepare a speech with a strong call to action.

tasks.title: Opposing viewpoints
tasks.description: Consider an opposing view on your problem. Journal insights.

tasks.title: Short story
tasks.description: Write a short story with a flashback element.

tasks.title: Humor in speech
tasks.description: Prepare a speech incorporating humor.

tasks.title: Cognitive load
tasks.description: Read about cognitive load theory and apply it to a task.

tasks.title: Thorough revision
tasks.description: Revise a piece thoroughly for clarity and impact.

tasks.title: Pitch and tone
tasks.description: Experiment with pitch and tone in a 3-minute speech.

tasks.title: Emotional intelligence
tasks.description: Reflect on how emotions influenced a recent interaction.

tasks.title: Specific audience
tasks.description: Write a piece tailored to a specific audience.

tasks.title: Personal experience
tasks.description: Craft a story from personal experience for a speech.

tasks.title: Imagine scenarios
tasks.description: Visualize 3 scenarios for achieving a goal.

tasks.title: Metaphors
tasks.description: Write a piece using metaphors or analogies.

tasks.title: Answer questions
tasks.description: Prepare answers for 3 potential audience questions.

tasks.title: Reflect on journey
tasks.description: Write a reflection on your 28-day skill journey.

tasks.title: Prepare to share
tasks.description: Polish a piece for sharing with others.

tasks.title: Public speaking
tasks.description: Research local public speaking opportunities.

tasks.title: New skill
tasks.description: Identify a new skill to learn post-plan.

tasks.title: Revise with feedback
tasks.description: Revise a piece based on feedback received.

tasks.title: Analyze speech
tasks.description: Record a speech and analyze it for improvement.

tasks.title: Teach a concept
tasks.description: Prepare a lesson on a concept you’ve learned.

tasks.title: New format
tasks.description: Write in a format you’ve never tried (e.g., poem).

tasks.title: Mentor someone
tasks.description: Plan how to mentor someone in speaking.

tasks.title: Gratitude
tasks.description: Write about something you’re grateful for.

tasks.title: Journey reflection
tasks.description: Write a reflection on your writing growth.

tasks.title: Passionate topic
tasks.description: Prepare a speech on a topic you’re passionate about.

tasks.title: Philosophical concept
tasks.description: Read about a philosophical idea and reflect.

tasks.title: Philosophical essay
tasks.description: Write an essay on a philosophical question.

tasks.title: Debate prep
tasks.description: Prepare arguments for a debate on your topic.

tasks.title: Visualize goals
tasks.description: Visualize a goal and list steps to achieve it.

tasks.title: Vision statement
tasks.description: Write a personal vision statement.

tasks.title: Vision speech
tasks.description: Prepare a speech about your vision.

tasks.title: Skill interconnection
tasks.description: Reflect on how thinking, writing, and speaking connect.

tasks.title: Summary
tasks.description: Write a summary of your 28-day experience.

tasks.title: Final speech
tasks.description: Deliver a speech on what you’ve learned.
